title: Around the Districts : Askamore to Carnew
body_text:
Around the Districts: Askamore to Carnew
ASKAMORE
Notes email contact
Please email notes for the paper to maryberniedoran@gmail.com
St. Brigid’s Church news
First Friday: Mass times: Askamore 6pm Kilrush 9.30am
Askamore’s Annual Knock Pilrimage
The annual Askamore Pilgrimage to Knock will take place on Monday 10th July/Tuesday 11th July. Details to follow later.
Kilrush’s Annual Pilgrimage to Knock: Will take place on Tuesday 11th July .
First Communion: We ask you to pray for our young children from Ballyroebuck National School Ballyellis National School who will receive the Sacrament of First Communion in the coming weeks.
Askamore Prayer Group continues in the Prayer Chapel in Askamore Church each Thursday at 7pm
Ballyellis NS Split the Pot
Winner of Split the Pot on Friday 28th April was Angela Morris, c/o Ballyellis NS - winning €130. Split the Pot envelopes can be had from any parent in the school or by calling into the school. Many thanks to everyone for your support. It is much appreciated.
Askamore Community Council
Our fabulous Tidy Towns committee are holding a table quiz to raise funds for the upkeep of the park and surrounding areas around the village to keep it looking beautiful. The Table Quiz will take place on Friday 19th May at 8.00pm. The entry fee is €10 per person. 4 per table.
Next Social Dance in Askamore Hall Y25 F6D8 is on Friday 5th May. Music by Liam Mannering & Maria. Doors open at 9pm. Dancing starts at 9.30pm Admission €10. Refreshments served. Looking forward to seeing you all.
Steps & Styles dance lessons every Wednesday evening 8.30pm. Everyone is welcome.
Pilates every Wednesday morning in Askamore Hall at 9am.
Zumba Classes will take placed every Wednesday at 7pm in Askamore Hall.
Kilrush Askamore GAA
Lotto - There was no winner of the last draw. The numbers were 3,13,15,17. Lucky dip winners were Danny Nolan, James Lancaster, Alan Owens, Paidi Buttle. Seller’s Prize: Kit Kennedy. Next Draw is on Tuesday 25th April in Kilrush/Askamore GAA Grounds on May 8th at 10pm. Jackpot is now €8,800. Tickets can be purchased from any club member, in Jim Byrne’s, Codd’s Kilrush and Coleman’s Tombrack.
Club and County Draw - A big thank you to all who supported the draw. The funds raised from this draw helps towards the running cost of our grounds. Congratulations to Raymond Lancaster, winning a €50 Co. Wexford Chamber shopping voucher. Next draws take place on Wednesday 31st May.
Ballyroebuck Hall
Ballyroebuck Hall hosts a weekly social get together on Wednesday mornings from 10am to 12pm. For €4, you can play a few books of community bingo and enjoy a cup of tea and the old catch up while you are there.
BALLYCANEW
Skittles Tournament
A Skittles tournament will be held at Goslins. Teams of 4, €40 entry. Closing date May 7. First games on Monday May 15. Contact Goslins phil Byrne on 086-8600122. House rules applies. All fee to prize fund plus €1000 bar top up.
Zumba Class
An adult Zumba Class has started at Ballycanew National School Hall, continuing on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 7 p.m. to 8 p.m.
Step into the summer with easy to follow dance moves. The workout that doesn’t feel like work! Get fit for the summer or just shake off the stress of the day. Zumba is great for cardio fitness, coordination and feel good endorphins. All levels are welcome and no previous experience needed. Contact ainezumba@gmail.com.
St Patrick’s GAA
Cul Camps - 2023 Official Wexford GAA Cul Camps are now live for bookings. Clg Naomh Padraig dates are from July 17 to July 21. Visit https://www.kelloggsculcamps.gaa.ie to book.
Club and County Draw - Tickets are now available for anyone who may be interested. €50 to be in 3 monthly draws with fantastic prizes. Please support as it is very important our club sell our allocation of tickets.
Gaelic4mothers and others – St Patrick’s Gaelic4mothers and others is back on Wednesdays at 8 p.m. on the astro in Camolin. All newcomers are welcome, no experience necessary.
Pilates
Pilates is on every Thursday from 7pm to 8pm in the Ballycanew Resource Centre - cost €8 per session. A great workout for men and women alike. Drop down and try. Suitable for all fitness levels.
FRHPT Fitness Classes
Ladies fitness class every Tuesday morning. New time of 9am. This class is suitable for all levels of fitness. Some small weights and floor exercises involved. Remember to bring a mat. Cost €8. Text or call 0858887182 for more info or to book a place.
Ballycanew Resource Centre
Have you heard about the amazing facilities on offer at Ballycanew Resource Centre? We have something for everyone!
If you’re looking for some fun and social activities, we have short mat bowls, scooch, and table tennis. Plus, we have a repair cafe coming soon where you can bring your broken items and learn how to fix them.
For those who want to get active and stay healthy, we have ladies keep fit on Tuesday mornings at 9:30, Pilates on Thursday evenings at 7pm, and yoga starting on Wednesday 4th April.
And if you’re a part of the active retirement community, we have a Friday morning session from 10am to 12:30pm.
We encourage everyone in the community to take advantage of the fantastic facilities on their doorstep and support the Resource Center moving forward. It’s a great way to stay active, meet new people, and have fun!
Don’t miss out, come and check out the Ballycanew Resource Centre today!
Little Ducklings Playschool
Little Ducklings Playschool are now taking enrolments for September 2023. Avail of the free playschool facility with Little Ducklings for your child. Limited places available so contact Andrea at 087 9437166 to secure your child’s place now.
Local notes
If you have anything that you would like to be included in the local notes then please contact Ann at 087 7433684 by 5 p.m. on Sundays evenings or email annkehoe@yahoo.ie by 5pm on Sundays evenings or email annkehoe@yahoo.ie
BALLYGARRETT
FAI Soccer Camp
The FAI Summer Soccer School is coming back to Killenagh Park this summer. 17-21 July 2023 (10am-1pm daily). The camp is suitable for boys and girls aged 6-14years of age. Booking is now open. Visit www.killenaghwanderers.com for more details. A fun filled way to spend a week over the summer holidays and develope your football skills
Pilates classes
Pilates classes are continuing in Killenagh Soccer Clubhouse on Wednesday mornings at 10.15am. €8 per class, pay as you go. All levels, all ages, male and female. Contact Tim at 0876715467.
Killenagh Wanderers FC
The Indoor Astro pitch is now available to hire for childrens parties and 5a side soccer. Contact Danny Whelan - killenaghwanderersafc@gmail.com .
Lotto - The Killenagh Wanderers lotto can now be played online at clubforce.com/clubs/soccer-killenagh-wanderers-afc-wexford. All online entries must be made by 6 p.m. on the evening of the draw. Paper tickets continue to be on sale and can be bought at Rath’s Stores Ballygarrett and from usual ticket sellers.
Numbers drawn on 24th April were 8, 9, 23, 27. No Jackpot Winner of €10,000. One Match 3 Winner. Congratulations Una Loughlin, you win €100. Next Draw Monday 1st May. Next week’s Jackpot €10,100.
Cahore Book Club
Cahore Book Club meets on the 2nd Thursday of the month in the Strand Restaurant, Cahore from 7 p.m. to 9 p.m. Due to an amazing turnout we have now reached our full quota of members. For more information contact Jackie on 086 3895654
Local Notes
If you have anything that you would like to be included in the local notes then please contact Ann at 087 7433684 or email ballygarrettnotes@gmail.com by 5 p.m. on Sunday evenings.
BOOLAVOGUE
Darkness into Light
There will be a sunrise walk in Boolavogue on May the 6th. to raise funds for Pieta House.The walk will start at St. Cormac’s church at 4.15am and travel around Ballytracey lane and back to Boolavogue where tea and coffee will be available in the hall after the walk. Everyone is welcome to join in and if you wish to make a donation, you can do so on the Pieta Facebook page.
GAA/Camogie/LGFA news
The club had two winners in the recent Model County draw with Helen Rath, Avonbeg, Ferns winning a €150 voucher for the Amber Springs hotel in Gorey and Dorothy Hall winning a €50 shopping voucher.
In the All County Hurling league clash with Oulart the Ballagh played in Monageer last week, our lads were withing a point or two of our neighbours until the last quarter. Oulart seemed to put on a spurt for the last ten minutes of the game and ran out winners by 2-14 to 0-12. This result leaves our lads in mid-table with games agains Duffry Rovers and Ballygarrett still to be played.
The Junior hurlers beat Ballyhogue by a single point, 1-15 to 0-17 away in Ballyhogue on Sunday the 23rd. of April. This leaves them in second place, on equal points with Cloughbawn, but behind on score difference. Their game against Cloughbawn on the 13th. of May should be thriller.
School news
If you check out Boolavogue school’s Facebook page you can see a fantastic video of the buildings, the site and the pupils taken by drone. It gives a great view of the school and the pupils and staff would like to thank Michael Brierley, a parent, for this wonderful footage.
Soccer news
St. Cormac’s Golf Classic will take place in Ballymoney Golf club on Friday the 1st of September. The cost for a team of 4 is €120 and you can book a tee-time by ringing 085-2123755 or 053-9421976. Tee-times start from 8.30am and there will be a barbeque on the day. Early booking is advised.
The club’s U-12 team were 1-0 down away to Taghmon last week but a Clara Doran goal brought the sides level just before half time. Not long into the second half, Clara found the net again and when Cian O’Loughlin made it 3-1 near the finish, the points were assured.
Church Repairs
Moneys provided by the Mayoral candidates, Louise Lawless and Jimmy Shugs Gahan helped repair the broken glass in the roadside gable of St. Cormac’s church last week. Cahill Glass & Glazing from Bunclody did the needful and the newly formed Parish Committee hopes that this is the start of undertaking many overdue projects in and around the Church and parish property.
CARNEW
Split the Pot
The lucky winner of our Split the Pot draw for Scoil Aodan Naofa Carnew was Fr Casey, who won €215. Congratulations. Our seller’s prize winner was Kathleen Molloy and Lacey Mae Fortune the lucky dip winner. Our next split the pot draw takes place Friday 5th May. Thank you for your continued support.
Coláiste Bhríde Split the Pot
Congratulations to Lisa Elliott, Carnew who was this week’s winner of our Split the Pot draw. Well done also to Finessa Byrne who won the sellers’ prize.
Ballyellis Split the Pot
Winner of Split the Pot on Friday 28th April was Angela Morris, c/o Ballyellis NS–winning €130. Split the Pot envelopes can be had from any parent in the school or by calling into the school. Many thanks to everyone for your support. It is much appreciated.
Askamore Hall
Our fabulous Tidy Towns committee are holding a table quiz to raise funds for the upkeep of the park and surrounding areas around the village to keep it looking beautiful. The Table Quiz will take place on Friday 19th May at 8.00pm. The entry fee is €10 per person. 4 per table.
Next Social Dance in Askamore Hall Y25 F6D8 is on Friday 5th May. Music by Liam Mannering & Maria. Doors open at 9pm. Dancing starts at 9.30pm Admission €10. Refreshments served. Looking forward to seeing you all.
Steps & Styles dance lessons every Wednesday evening 8.30pm. Everyone is welcome.
Pilates every Wednesday morning in Askamore Hall at 9am.
Zumba Classes will take placed every Wednesday at 7pm in Askamore Hall.
Knock trips
The Askamore pilgrimage to knock will take place on Monday 10th July. Contact Mary Kenny 086 1541948. Kilrush pilgrimage is Tuesday 11th July.
Table quiz
There is a table quiz on 12th May in Kenny’s at 8.30pm all proceeds will go towards the cost of the Feile teams who are representing Wicklow in the Feile in June, all support would be greatly appreciated.
Pilates
Pilates classes take place on a Tuesday night in Colaiste Bhride Carnew and Thursday night in the GAA grounds, to book your place go to Kpilates on Facebook and book your slot.
GAA club room
The meeting room in the club house is available for meetings, etc if you would like to book please contact Niamh on 0877702498
Craft class
Craft classes continue on Tuesday afternoons from 2-4pm in Carnew Community Care please come along if you are interested or just to spend a few hours with other people and bring your own craft. All welcome.
Tinahely Craft Market
The Tinahely Craft Market is on every Saturday from 10am to 4pm. It is situated opposite Murphy’s butcher. There is a wide variety of fabulous crafts including up cycled and recycled textiles, stained glass, macrame, jewellery, candles and soap, embroidery and various art works. Please come along see all the work from these very talented local crafters. For further info ring 087 2281999.
